plants.name: Rosa spp.
plants.description: Roses are iconic flowering shrubs widely cultivated in gardens and landscapes worldwide. They produce large, fragrant flowers that come in many colors, often blooming repeatedly through the summer.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to early autumn (May to September)
plants.location: Temperate regions globally, including North America, Europe, and Asia
plants.funFact: Roses have been symbols of love and beauty for thousands of years and can have over 300 species worldwide.

plants.name: Lupinus polyphyllus
plants.description: This tall perennial herb produces striking spikes of pea-like flowers, well known for their vivid colors and attractiveness to pollinators.
plants.location: Native to western North America but cultivated widely in temperate regions
plants.funFact: Lupines can fix nitrogen in the soil, enriching the ground and helping other plants grow.

plants.name: Tibouchina urvilleana
plants.description: An evergreen shrub bearing large, velvety purple flowers that bloom profusely during summer in subtropical and tropical climates.
plants.location: Native to Brazil, grown as ornamental shrub in warm climates including southern USA and Mediterranean
plants.funFact: Tibouchina flowers attract hummingbirds and butterflies, enhancing garden biodiversity.

plants.name: Nelumbo nucifera
plants.description: A large aquatic plant with round floating leaves and striking, fragrant flowers that open in the morning and close at night, often blooming during warm summer months.
plants.location: Native to Asia and Australia, found in warm freshwater ponds and lakes
plants.funFact: The Sacred Lotus flower is revered in many cultures symbolizing purity and spiritual awakening.
